name: Tomato Sev Curry
history: Tomato Sev Curry is a creative twist on traditional Indian curries, combining the crunch of sev with the tanginess of tomatoes to create a unique dish.
description: A tangy and spicy curry made with a tomato-based sauce, infused with Indian spices, and finished with crispy sev sprinkled on top.

equipment.name: Frying Pan
equipment.description: For frying the sev if not using pre-made sev.

instructions.title: Prepare Tomato Mixture
instructions.description: Blend tomatoes, onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili into a smooth puree.

instructions.title: Cook the Curry Base
instructions.description: Heat oil in a saucepan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the tomato mixture, turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the oil separates.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water to the saucepan and bring the curry to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Sev
instructions.description: Just before serving, sprinkle sev over the curry. Do not mix, as the sev should remain crispy.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or Indian breads like chapati.

tips: Add the sev just before serving to maintain its crunch.
Adjust the chili as per your spice tolerance.
variations: Add a splash of cream for a richer curry.
Incorporate boiled peas or paneer for added texture and protein.

storage.shelfLife: Up to 2 days without sev, add sev when serving
storage.instructions: Store the curry in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Add fresh sev upon reheating.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on the stove. Add sev after reheating.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian curry bowl.
Garnish with a sprinkle of sev and coriander leaves for an appealing look.
